Endpoint functions¶

Here are the endpoints that are available for the time tracker webapp.

User¶

POST /users¶
List all users / Create a new user

Example output:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: text/javascript

{
    username: "John Doe",
    email: "johndoe@gmail.com"
}
GET /users¶
List all users / Create a new user

Example output:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: text/javascript

{
    username: "John Doe",
    email: "johndoe@gmail.com"
}
PUT /users/(username)¶

Get, update or delete the user matching the given username

Parameters:
  • username – string
Return:

nothing in case of DELETE, otherwise the serialized User object is returned
DELETE /users/(username)¶

Get, update or delete the user matching the given username

Parameters:
  • username – string
Return:

nothing in case of DELETE, otherwise the serialized User object is returned
GET /users/(username)¶

Get, update or delete the user matching the given username

Parameters:
  • username – string
Return:

nothing in case of DELETE, otherwise the serialized User object is returned

GET /companies/(companyname)¶

GET /projects¶

POST /projects/(projectname)/activities¶
GET /projects/(projectname)/activities¶
